oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Ronnie Milsap
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Ronnie Milsap (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ronnie Milsap; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Pure Love [excerpt] [featuring Rick Phillips radio spot for the Hallmarks of Country Music] (Ronnie Milsap) -- (00:20) Pure Love [excerpt] (Ronnie Milsap) -- (00:37) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:15) WAC assignment to C.I.D. radio spot hosted by Rick Phillips -- (01:37) A ""Pure Love"" radio spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (02:34) Pure Love (Ronnie Milsap) -- (04:52) Milsap discusses his youth as someone who was heavily influenced by music, and Phillips inquires as to if Milsap had other aspirations as a child -- (07:14) Phillips inquires as to how Milsap gained confidence through his disability -- (08:48) That Girl Who Waits on Tables (Ronnie Milsap) -- (11:38) Keys to Quality [featuring unidentified hosted] ([Unidentified]) -- (12:38) Dishonorable Discharge commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (13:23) Four Walls (Ronnie Milsap) -- (16:24) Milsap recalls how his teachers would disapprove of him practicing country music; additionally, Milsap recalls his first day at college -- (19:54) My Love is Deep (Ronnie Milsap) -- (22:25) Philips introduces the commercial break -- (22:35) Savings bond commercial break hosted by an unidentified voice -- (23:35) Savings bond commercial break hosted by Phillips -- (23:46) Please Don't Tell Me How the Story Ends (Ronnie Milsap) -- (26:20) Phillips recalls how Milsap will sign script autographs, and Milsap describes how he developed his signature -- (27:53) Phillips asks Milsap to recall his professional career -- (29:37) Milsap and Phillips discuss Milsap's early successes -- (30:54) I Hate You (Ronnie Milsap) -- (33:43) Conservation commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (34:23) American Medical Association commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (34:55) (All Together Now) Let's Fall Apart (Ronnie Milsap) -- (37:19) Pollution commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (38:18) Pass Me By (Ronnie Milsap) -- (41:13) Milsap reflects on how he prepared for his road trip; additionally, Phillips inquires as to how Milsap began playing with Charley Pride -- (45:27) Legend in My Time (Ronnie Milsap) -- (48:22) Phillips hosts an Army Research Labs radio spot -- (48:54) The Biggest Lie (Ronnie Milsap) -- (51:09) Phillips inquires Milsap's upcoming television performances, and both say their goodbyes -- (53:05) An unidentified host performs a reenlistment radio spot for the military -- (53:39) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (55:43) Phillips introduces the next week's guests: the Statler Brothers -- (55:52) Do You Remember These (Statler Brothers) -- (58:35) The Statler Brothers reveal how they came up with ""Do You Remember These"" -- (1:00:03) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
